sense.name: investigation
sense.commentary: ANALYSIS[+event] Inspecting the individual parts of something, and their relation in making up a whole.
sense.examples: The analysis of the DNA revealed that John was the killer. I performed an analysis of the newspaper. His clever analysis proved that the painting was a fraud.

sense.name: type of thinking
sense.commentary: The capacity to analyze, or the kind of thought that goes into analyzing things.
sense.examples: Use your incredible powers of analysis to figure out what's going to happen next.

sense.name: psychotherapy
sense.commentary: Psychoanalysis. A set of techniques for uncovering motivation and promoting mental health.
sense.examples: I've been undergoing analysis for three years, but I'm still afraid of spiders. Analysis showed the patient to have some unresolved retention issues.

sense.name: piece of criticism
sense.commentary: A piece of critical writing, usually on literature.
sense.examples: I published an analysis of Conrad's 'Heart of Darkness'. If you're going to graduate school for English, I hope you like writing literary analyses.

sense.name: word manipulation
sense.commentary: The use of closed-class words instead of inflections; e.g. "the father of the bride" instead of "the bride's father". I have a feeling this is very rare.
sense.examples: Use analysis if you want to sound more intelligent, and also if you hate inflections.

sense.name: subtopic of calculus
sense.commentary: A branch of mathematics involving calculus and the theory of limits; also sequences, series, and differentiation.
sense.examples: I'm taking a math class called "Calculus and Topics in Analysis".
